intro: Tetrapterys ambigua, commonly known as the zigzag hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Tetrapterys ambigua is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
